_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Valence Natural Gas Services goal is to create new markets for natural gas through mobile infrastructure. Valence is committed to providing and maintaining a safe and healthy environment for all employees, customers, partners, contractors, suppliers and members of the public.



Valence is committed to reduce the potential for unsafe situations by developing, implementing and maintaining an Emergency Prevention, Preparedness and Response Programs and works with the local community.



The Valence Mobile Flare Gas Capture (FGC-003) Tailgunner facility is tied closely with it partner ConocoPhillips Tailgunner facility. The Valence facility is composed of one process located at the ConocoPhillips Tailgunner Facility, within the plant boundary.



The facility captures ConocoPhillips flare gas and recovers natural gas liquids. This facility recovers primarily propane although may contain small quantities of ethane or butane.



Valence Mobile FGC-003 Tailgunner facility went into operation in March of 2021. The Valence FGC-003 Tailgunner facility has had no process related accidents in its history.



Valence has a developed emergency response plan for this site. The first level of response is engineered safety systems e.g., equipment shuts downs due to vibration, levels or pressures or gas detection all which shuts down the equipment in a safe state. Where incidents may escape from engineered designs, they are managed by engineered mitigation systems e.g., pressure safety reliefs or relief systems to the shared flare. If an emergency were ever to extend beyond these cases, Valence works with ConocoPhillips to protect workers through evacuation plans.



Valence has identified that most scenarios identified within the modelling are very unlikely either requiring a sudden and complete failure of a vessel or a pool fire beneath one. To ensure these are not credible, Valence maintains a vessel and mechanical integrity program for equipment. Sloping of the yard has been eng

ineered to prevent pooling.



For the case reviewed where a vehicle drives away damaging hoses Valence mitigates this by:

?    trained and competent operators and drivers, 

?    transport fill systems are designed to shut down on low pressure in the case of a leak, 

?    fill systems are designed to shut down on LEL detected in the area, 

?    lights and indicators at truck loading stations verifying grounding and valve positioning, and

?    ESD stations at truck loading.



With these controls and systems in place, Valence believes that it poses little risk to workers or the environment due to process safety incidents.
